content: careful not to twist magic loop distribute stitches so there are 32 sts on each needle dpn s distribute stitches evenly on your needles ribbing round *k3 p1* repeat from * to the end of round work ribbing round for a total of 12 rnds approximately 2 75cm or just over 1 inch i ve knitted two rounds with cc and 10 rounds with mc leg knit 1 round work the increase round *k8 m1l* repeat from * to the end of round 8 sts increase d 72 sts in total work rounds 1-24 of the colorwork chart the chart repeats 6 times around the sock note you can repeat rnds 1-24 more times than instructed here knit 1 round work the decrease round *k7 k2tog* repeat from * to the end of round 8 sts decrease d 64 sts in total knit 1 round work rounds 1-10 of the texture chart chart a is worked on the front of the sock first 32 sts and chart b is worked on the back of the sock last 32 sts repeat rounds 1-10 two times more 3 times in total or to desired length make sure to end with round 10 but work only the first 32sts of this round pm continue with the heel heel i like the no-wrap short row heel by stone knits but feel free to substitute it for your favorite heel short row or heel flap keep in mind that short row heels generally don t work very well for people with high insteps foot continue to work texture chart a across the first 32 sts sm k to bor note bor and the marker divides our sock in two sections front first 32 sts and back repeat round 1-10 until your sock foot measures 1 57 inches / 5 cm shorter than desired length when tried on this should be roughly at the end of your pinky toe you don t have to end with round 10 toe i like a version of a wedge toe that is slightly longer than usual and has 4 sts between the decreases instead of the usual two - thank you @cnyttan cnottan for that inspiration feel free to substitute it for your preferred toe note if you re using shorties you ll have to change needles to magic loop/dpns at some point round 1 knit round 2 decrease round *k2 ssk knit to 4 sts before marker k2tog k2* sm repeat from * once more bor acts as 2nd marker repeat rounds 1 and 2 for 8 times in total for 32 sts in total 16 sts on each needle then repeat the decrease round 3 additional times for 20 sts in total 10 sts on each needle graft toe using the kitchener stitch i like this method to prevent the „ears from forming weave in the ends and you re done please tag me if you decide to share your finished creation i m @crochetedbybogusia on instagram
